intro: Aeschynomene filosa, commonly known as silky aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces slender, hairy pods that contain small, brown seeds. Aeschynomene filosa is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
